meanings.definition: (Latin) to put in the way, set against, oppose, object
meanings.english_definition: (Latin) to put in the way, set against, oppose, object

examples.translation: To oppose oneself to the enemy.
examples.note: Example sentence demonstrating the meaning of opposing.

collocations: opponere murum (to build a wall against)

usage_notes.explanation: 'Opponere' is a Latin verb with a range of meanings centered around placing something against or in opposition to something else. It can refer to physical opposition or abstract disagreement.

level_frequency.notes: Latin vocabulary; frequency depends on the text.

readability_explanation.text: This is a Latin verb, so readability depends on familiarity with Latin. Understanding its components (ob- and ponere) helps with comprehension.

example_sentences.translation: Mountains stand in the way of the journey.
